鬧.definition: noisy; cacophonous; to make noise; to disturb; to vent (feelings); to fall ill; to have an attack (of sickness); to go in (for some activity); to joke

鬧事.definition: to cause trouble; to create a disturbance

鬧僵.definition: (of a relationship or situation) to become strained and tense

鬧場.definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera; to create a disturbance

鬧大.definition: (of a person) to make a big fuss about (sth); to make a big deal of; (of an adverse situation) to get ugly; to blow up; to escalate

鬧太套.definition: (Internet slang) transcription of "not at all" – English words in a song promoting the 2008 Beijing Olympics sung by Huang Xiaoming 黃曉明|黄晓明[Huang2 Xiao3 ming2], who became a laughing stock in China because his pronunciation was perceived as embarrassingly bad; to be a laughing stock; to make a fool of oneself (i.e. equivalent to 鬧笑話|闹笑话[nao4 xiao4 hua5])

鬧彆扭.definition: to be difficult with sb; to provoke disagreement; at loggerheads; to fall out with

鬧心.definition: to be vexed or annoyed; to feel queasy

鬧情緒.definition: to be in a bad mood

鬧房.definition: see 鬧洞房|闹洞房[nao4 dong4 fang2]

鬧新房.definition: see 鬧洞房|闹洞房[nao4 dong4 fang2]

鬧洞房.definition: disturbing the privacy of bridal room (Chinese custom where guests banter with and play pranks on the newlyweds)

鬧矛盾.definition: to be at loggerheads; to have a falling out

鬧笑話.definition: to make a fool of oneself

鬧翻.definition: to have a falling out; to have a big argument

鬧著玩兒.definition: to play games; to joke around; to play a joke on sb

鬧轟轟.definition: variant of 鬧哄哄|闹哄哄[nao4 hong1 hong1]

鬧騰.definition: to disturb; to create confusion; to make a din
